natural_language_statements: Employees ranked as professors or tenured assistant professors can select from, insert into, and delete from graduate admission related tables in the database.
datalog_actions: can_select(E, T) :- Employee(E), GraduateAdmissionTable(T), (is_professor(E); is_tenured_assistant_professor(E)). can_insert(E, T) :- Employee(E), GraduateAdmissionTable(T), (is_professor(E); is_tenured_assistant_professor(E)). can_delete(E, T) :- Employee(E), GraduateAdmissionTable(T), (is_professor(E); is_tenured_assistant_professor(E)).

natural_language_statements: Customer Service Reps, Pharmacists, and Billing Reps can collect and use customer name and date of birth to help confirm identity.
datalog_relationships: has_name(C, N) :- Customer(C), Name(N). has_dob(C, DOB) :- Customer(C), DateOfBirth(DOB).
datalog_actions: can_collect_and_use(CSR, C, N, DOB) :- CustomerServiceRep(CSR), Customer(C), has_name(C, N), has_dob(C, DOB). can_collect_and_use(PH, C, N, DOB) :- Pharmacist(PH), Customer(C), has_name(C, N), has_dob(C, DOB). can_collect_and_use(BR, C, N, DOB) :- BillingRep(BR), Customer(C), has_name(C, N), has_dob(C, DOB).

natural_language_statements: Customer service reps can use credit card number for the purpose of updating records if requested by a patient.
datalog_actions: can_use(R, CCN, REC) :- CustomerServiceRep(R), CreditCardNumber(CCN), Record(REC), Patient(P), has_requested(P, REC).

natural_language_statements: Customer Service Reps, Pharmacists, and Billing Reps can collect and use customer name and e-mail addresses.
datalog_relationships: has_name(C, N) :- Customer(C), Name(N). has_email(C, E) :- Customer(C), Email(E).
datalog_actions: can_collect_and_use(CSR, C, N, E) :- CustomerServiceRep(CSR), Customer(C), Name(N), Email(E), has_name(C, N), has_email(C, E). can_collect_and_use(PH, C, N, E) :- Pharmacist(PH), Customer(C), Name(N), Email(E), has_name(C, N), has_email(C, E). can_collect_and_use(BR, C, N, E) :- BillingRep(BR), Customer(C), Name(N), Email(E), has_name(C, N), has_email(C, E).

natural_language_statements: Shipping Reps can use customer name and customer mailing addresses to ship orders.
datalog_relationships: has_name(C, Name) :- Customer(C). has_address(C, Address) :- Customer(C).
datalog_actions: can_ship(SR, O) :- ShippingRep(SR), Order(O), Customer(C), has_name(C, Name), has_address(C, Address).

natural_language_statements: Billing Reps can use credit card numbers for order processing.
datalog_actions: can_use_for_order_processing(B, CC, O) :- BillingRep(B), CreditCardNumber(CC), Order(O), has_access_to(B, CC).

natural_language_statements: Customer Service Reps can modify credit card numbers for order processing, if the customer is notified by email of the change.
datalog_relationships:
has_order(C, O) :- Customer(C), Order(O).
has_credit_card(O, CC) :- Order(O), CreditCard(CC).
notified_by_email(C, CC) :- Customer(C), CreditCard(CC).
datalog_actions: can_modify(R, O, CC) :- CustomerServiceRep(R), Order(O), CreditCard(CC), has_order(C, O), has_credit_card(O, CC), notified_by_email(C, CC).

natural_language_statements: Customer service reps, ducks or Lawyers can use credit card number for the purpose of making treatment decisions if customer has opted-in.
datalog_actions:
can_use_for_treatment(CSR, C, CCN, TD) :- CustomerServiceRep(CSR), Customer(C), CreditCardNumber(CCN), TreatmentDecision(TD), has_opted_in(C, CCN).
can_use_for_treatment(D, C, CCN, TD) :- Duck(D), Customer(C), CreditCardNumber(CCN), TreatmentDecision(TD), has_opted_in(C, CCN).
can_use_for_treatment(L, C, CCN, TD) :- Lawyer(L), Customer(C), CreditCardNumber(CCN), TreatmentDecision(TD), has_opted_in(C, CCN).

natural_language_statements: Admission nurses use SSN for reviewing eligibility if requested by a patient who is returning.
datalog_actions: can_review_eligibility(N, P, S) :- AdmissionNurse(N), Patient(P), SSN(S), is_returning(P).

natural_language_statements: Customer service reps and managers may collect and use name and social security number for the purpose of confirming identity.
datalog_relationships: has_name(P, N) :- Person(P), Name(N). has_ssn(P, SSN) :- Person(P), SocialSecurityNumber(SSN).
datalog_actions: can_collect_and_use(R, P, N, SSN) :- CustomerServiceRep(R), Person(P), Name(N), SocialSecurityNumber(SSN), has_name(P, N), has_ssn(P, SSN). can_collect_and_use(M, P, N, SSN) :- Manager(M), Person(P), Name(N), SocialSecurityNumber(SSN), has_name(P, N), has_ssn(P, SSN).

natural_language_statements: The organisation may use email addresses to answer inquiries.
datalog_actions: can_use_email(O, E, I) :- Organisation(O), EmailAddress(E), Inquiry(I), has_inquiry(O, I).

natural_language_statements: Supervisors can collect personal information if required by law.
datalog_actions: can_collect(S, PI) :- Supervisor(S), PersonalInfo(PI), required_by_law(PI).

natural_language_statements: Financial consultants can collect and use customer name for the purpose of confirming identity.
datalog_actions: can_collect_and_use(FC, C, Name) :- FinancialConsultant(FC), Customer(C), has_name(C, Name).

natural_language_statements: Financial analysts can use customer accounts to make loan decisions.
datalog_actions: can_make_loan_decision(FA, CA, LD) :- FinancialAnalyst(FA), CustomerAccount(CA), LoanDecision(LD), has_access_to(FA, CA).

natural_language_statements: Management can report customer transactions if required by law.
datalog_actions: can_report(M, C, T) :- Manager(M), Customer(C), Transaction(T), has_transaction(C, T), required_by_law(T).

natural_language_statements: The director chooses options from the package to give to all employees.
datalog_actions: can_give(D, O, E) :- Director(D), Option(O), Employee(E), Package(P), has_option(P, O).

natural_language_statements: He or she also can read the information about the distribution of options.
datalog_actions: can_read(U, DI) :- User(U), DistributionInfo(DI), has_access_to(U, DI).

natural_language_statements: The director can promote an employee to be a  manager.
datalog_actions: can_promote(D, E) :- Director(D), Employee(E), is_director_of(D, E).

natural_language_statements: An employee can appoint another employee to be his advocate, and have read access to his bonus information – for example, this might be useful if he needs help from a trade union.
datalog_actions: can_read(E2, B) :- Employee(E2), BonusInfo(B), has_advocate(E1, E2), owns_bonus_info(E1, B).

natural_language_statements: For example, write a check use case should be invoked by (authorized to) clerk role.
datalog_actions: can_invoke(C, UC) :- Clerk(C), CheckUseCase(UC), has_role(C, clerk).

natural_language_statements: If the invoice’s total amount exceeds one million, then two different supervisors must authorize the invoice.
datalog_actions: can_authorize(I) :- Invoice(I), exceeds_one_million(I), Supervisor(S1), Supervisor(S2), S1 != S2, authorized_by(I, S1), authorized_by(I, S2).

natural_language_statements: A professor can review the same project at most one time.
datalog_actions: can_review(P, PR) :- Professor(P), Project(PR), not has_reviewed(P, PR).

natural_language_statements: Only the business office manager and the dean can approve a project.
datalog_actions: can_approve(BOM, P) :- BusinessOfficeManager(BOM), Project(P), is_manager(BOM). can_approve(D, P) :- Dean(D), Project(P), is_dean(D).

natural_language_statements: The PC chair appoints the PC members.
datalog_actions: can_appoint(C, M) :- PC_Chair(C), PC_Member(M), appoints(C, M).

natural_language_statements: A PC member can resign his membership.
datalog_actions: can_resign(P, M) :- PC_Member(P), Membership(M), has_membership(P, M).

natural_language_statements: The reviewer of a paper can assign the paper to be sub-reviewed by an agent who is not an author of the paper and has not been assigned the same paper by another reviewer.
datalog_relationships:
is_author(A, P) :- Agent(A), Paper(P).
assigned_by(R, A, P) :- Reviewer(R), Agent(A), Paper(P).
datalog_actions: can_assign(R, A, P) :- Reviewer(R), Agent(A), Paper(P), not is_author(A, P), not assigned_by(_, A, P).

natural_language_statements: All members of Faculty can Assign both InternalGrades and ExternalGrades.
datalog_actions: can_assign(F, IG) :- Faculty(F), InternalGrade(IG). can_assign(F, EG) :- Faculty(F), ExternalGrade(EG).

natural_language_statements: The sole counter-example shows that a student with the freedom to assign external grades is also a ta but not a faculty member.
datalog_relationships:
is_ta(S) :- Student(S).
not_faculty(S) :- Student(S).
can_assign_external_grade(S, G) :- Student(S), Grade(G), is_ta(S), not_faculty(S).
datalog_actions: assign_external_grade(S, G) :- Student(S), Grade(G), can_assign_external_grade(S, G).

natural_language_statements: All members of role Faculty Family can receive External-Grades.
datalog_actions: can_receive(F, EG) :- FacultyFamilyMember(F), ExternalGrade(EG), has_role(F, 'Faculty Family').

natural_language_statements: If the subject is a faculty member, then permit that subject to assign grades.
datalog_actions: can_assign_grade(S, G) :- Subject(S), Grade(G), faculty_member(S).

natural_language_statements: If the subject is not a faculty member, then permit that subject to enroll in courses.
datalog_actions: can_enroll(S, C) :- Subject(S), Course(C), not faculty_member(S).

natural_language_statements: The manager has the broadest access to the information, including access to personal, financial, clinical and medical information about each resident.
datalog_relationships: has_access_to(M, I) :- Manager(M), Information(I), is_about(I, R).
datalog_actions: can_access(M, R, I) :- Manager(M), Resident(R), Information(I), is_about(I, R), has_access_to(M, I).

natural_language_statements: The care plan is updated in consultation with the resident or the responsible person.
datalog_actions: can_update_care_plan(S, CP, R, RP) :- Staff(S), CarePlan(CP), Resident(R), ResponsiblePerson(RP), (consulted_with(S, R); consulted_with(S, RP)).

natural_language_statements: Only the manager is allowed to delete the information about a resident but here also that right is restricted.
datalog_actions: can_delete(M, RI) :- Manager(M), ResidentInfo(RI), manages(M, R), associated_with(RI, R).

natural_language_statements: The health care workers are required to sign a confidentiality agreement before they have access to any resident data.
datalog_actions: can_access(H, RD) :- HealthCareWorker(H), ResidentData(RD), has_signed_confidentiality_agreement(H).

natural_language_statements: Access to emergency details is available for all staff.
datalog_actions: can_access(S, ED) :- Staff(S), EmergencyDetails(ED).

natural_language_statements: For a special purpose, access to an older medical record can be sought and obtained from the manager.
datalog_actions: can_access(U, MR) :- User(U), MedicalRecord(MR), is_older(MR), Manager(M), has_permission(M, U, MR).

natural_language_statements: Occasionally, due to pressing circumstances, it may be necessary for a visiting doctor to examine a resident who is not normally his or her patient.
datalog_actions: can_examine(D, R) :- Doctor(D), Resident(R), pressing_circumstances(), not is_patient_of(R, D).

natural_language_statements: This is permitted with the consent of the resident or the responsible person and the notification of the manager.
datalog_relationships: has_consent(R, A) :- Resident(R), Action(A). has_consent(RP, A) :- ResponsiblePerson(RP), Action(A). notified(M, A) :- Manager(M), Action(A).
datalog_actions: permitted(A) :- Action(A), (has_consent(R, A) ; has_consent(RP, A)), notified(M, A).

natural_language_statements: Privacy laws require, however, that a person should have full access to any information stored about them (unless the well-being of a third party would be jeopardised by revealing the information).
datalog_actions: can_access(P, I) :- Person(P), Information(I), has_information(P, I), not jeopardises_third_party(I).

natural_language_statements: A user should already grant diagnosing right to create medicine orders.
datalog_actions: can_create(U, MO) :- User(U), MedicineOrder(MO), has_diagnosing_right(U).

natural_language_statements: Only one user, here is the Pharmacy System, can load medicines to the medicine dispenser.
datalog_actions: can_load(PS, MD, M) :- PharmacySystem(PS), MedicineDispenser(MD), Medicine(M), not exists U (User(U), U != PS, can_load(U, MD, M)).

natural_language_statements: Pharmacy System may get reports and status information of the medicine dispenser.
datalog_actions: can_get_report(PS, MD) :- PharmacySystem(PS), MedicineDispenser(MD), has_report(MD). can_get_status(PS, MD) :- PharmacySystem(PS), MedicineDispenser(MD), has_status(MD).

natural_language_statements: Pharmacy System can load medicines to the dispenser only at a time interval 12:00-13:00 in a day.
datalog_actions: can_load(PS, M, D) :- PharmacySystem(PS), Medicine(M), Dispenser(D), current_time(T).

natural_language_statements: Only Doctors and Nurses can read patient records.
datalog_relationships: has_access(D, PR) :- Doctor(D), PatientRecord(PR). has_access(N, PR) :- Nurse(N), PatientRecord(PR).
datalog_actions: can_read(S, PR) :- has_access(S, PR).

natural_language_statements: Any subject with an e-mail name in the med.example.com domain can perform any action on any resource.
datalog_actions: can_perform(S, R, Action) :- Subject(S), Resource(R), has_email_domain(S, 'med.example.com').

natural_language_statements: A person, identified by his or her patient number, may read any record for which he or she is the designated patient.
datalog_actions: can_read(P, R) :- Person(P), Record(R), designated_patient(P, R).

natural_language_statements: A person may read any record for which he or she is the designated parent or guardian, and for which the patient is under 16 years of age.
datalog_relationships:
is_parent_or_guardian(P, PT) :- Person(P), Patient(PT).
age_under_16(PT) :- Patient(PT).
datalog_actions: can_read(P, R) :- Person(P), Record(R), Patient(PT), is_parent_or_guardian(P, PT), age_under_16(PT).

natural_language_statements: A physician may write to any medical element for which he or she is the designated primary care physician, provided an email is sent to the patient.
datalog_actions: can_write(P, ME) :- Physician(P), MedicalElement(ME), is_primary_care_physician(P, ME), email_sent_to_patient(ME).

natural_language_statements: Administrators can access only the administrative pages
datalog_actions: can_access(A, P) :- Administrator(A), Page(P), is_administrative_page(P).

natural_language_statements: Guests can access all the public areas of the site
datalog_actions: can_access(G, PA) :- Guest(G), PublicArea(PA), is_public(PA).

natural_language_statements: Owners can access their account, move funds, and review transactions.
datalog_actions: can_access(O, A) :- Owner(O), Account(A), owns(O, A). can_move_funds(O, F) :- Owner(O), Funds(F), owns(O, A). can_review_transactions(O, T) :- Owner(O), Transaction(T), owns(O, A).

natural_language_statements: Planners can access the sites financial planning and tax preparation functions
datalog_actions: can_access(P, S, F) :- Planner(P), Site(S), Function(F), has_function(S, F).

natural_language_statements: Payers can use the site's bill paying function .
datalog_actions: can_use(P, B) :- Payer(P), BillPayingFunction(B), has_access(P, B).

natural_language_statements: Data Owners can transfer ownership of information to other users.
datalog_actions: can_transfer(DO, U, I) :- DataOwner(DO), User(U), Information(I), owns(DO, I).

natural_language_statements: Data Owners can determine the type of access given to other users (read, write, copy, etc.).
datalog_actions: can_determine_access(DO, U, D, AT) :- DataOwner(DO), User(U), Data(D), AccessType(AT), owns(DO, D).

natural_language_statements: Users who do not have access to information should not be able to determine its characteristics (file size, file name, directory path, etc.)
datalog_actions: can_determine_characteristics(U, I) :- User(U), Information(I), has_access(U, I).

natural_language_statements: All users can read from a lower classification than the one they are granted (A secret user can read an unclassified document).
datalog_relationships:
has_classification(U, UC) :- User(U), Classification(UC).
has_classification(D, DC) :- Document(D), Classification(DC).
lower_classification(DC, UC) :- Classification(DC), Classification(UC), DC < UC.
datalog_actions: can_read(U, D) :- User(U), Document(D), has_classification(U, UC), has_classification(D, DC), lower_classification(DC, UC).

natural_language_statements: All users can write to a higher classification (A secret user can post information to a Top Secret resource).
datalog_relationships:
has_classification(U, C) :- User(U), Classification(C).
has_classification(R, C) :- Resource(R), Classification(C).
classification_level(C, L) :- Classification(C), Level(L).
datalog_actions: can_write(U, R) :- User(U), Resource(R), has_classification(U, C1), has_classification(R, C2), classification_level(C1, L1), classification_level(C2, L2), L1 < L2.

natural_language_statements: All users are given read or write access to objects only of the same classification (a secret user can only read or write to a secret document).
datalog_relationships:
has_classification(U, C) :- User(U), Classification(C).
has_classification(O, C) :- Object(O), Classification(C).
datalog_actions:
can_read(U, O) :- User(U), Object(O), has_classification(U, C), has_classification(O, C).
can_write(U, O) :- User(U), Object(O), has_classification(U, C), has_classification(O, C).

natural_language_statements: Staff can print on HP Laserjet 1.
datalog_actions: can_print(S, HP_Laserjet_1) :- Staff(S), Printer(HP_Laserjet_1).

natural_language_statements: David can assign the manager role to Alice.
datalog_relationships: can_assign(David, Alice, manager) :- Person(David), Person(Alice), Role(manager).
datalog_actions: assign_role(David, Alice, manager) :- can_assign(David, Alice, manager).

natural_language_statements: John can assign clerk to users from department A
datalog_actions: can_assign(John, U, clerk) :- User(John), User(U), Role(clerk), from_department(U, A).

natural_language_statements: Clerk can read from database.
datalog_actions: can_read(C, DB) :- Clerk(C), Database(DB).

natural_language_statements: Owners can read Name.
datalog_actions: can_read(O, N) :- Owner(O), Name(N), owns(O, N).

natural_language_statements: Clerks can add and change the Name, the date of birth, the Address and the Postcode.
datalog_actions:
can_add(C, N) :- Clerk(C), Name(N).
can_change(C, N) :- Clerk(C), Name(N).
can_add(C, DOB) :- Clerk(C), DateOfBirth(DOB).
can_change(C, DOB) :- Clerk(C), DateOfBirth(DOB).
can_add(C, A) :- Clerk(C), Address(A).
can_change(C, A) :- Clerk(C), Address(A).
can_add(C, P) :- Clerk(C), Postcode(P).
can_change(C, P) :- Clerk(C), Postcode(P).

natural_language_statements: All members of FACULTY can ASSIGN both INTERNALGRADES and EXTERNALGRADES.
datalog_actions: can_assign(F, IG) :- Faculty(F), InternalGrade(IG). can_assign(F, EG) :- Faculty(F), ExternalGrade(EG).

natural_language_statements: All members of STUDENT can RECEIVE EXTERNALGRADES.
datalog_actions: can_receive(S, EG) :- Student(S), ExternalGrade(EG), member_of(S, STUDENT).

natural_language_statements: During the submission phase, an author may submit a paper.
datalog_actions: can_submit(A, P) :- Author(A), Paper(P), is_author_of(A, P).

natural_language_statements: During the review phase, reviewer may submit a review for paper if reviewer is assigned to review paper.
datalog_actions: can_submit_review(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), assigned_to(R, P).

natural_language_statements: During the meeting phase, reviewer can read the scores for paper if reviewer has submitted a review for paper.
datalog_actions: can_read_scores(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), submitted_review(R, P).

natural_language_statements: In the current paper system, all the information stored about a resident is accessible to the resident by arrangement with the manager.
datalog_actions: can_access(R, I) :- Resident(R), Information(I), has_access(R, I).

natural_language_statements: Supervisor can not  execute the write a check use case.
datalog_actions: cannot_execute(S, C) :- Supervisor(S), Check(C).

natural_language_statements: For example, a user should not record and verify the same invoice.
datalog_relationships: recorded_by(U, I) :- User(U), Invoice(I). verified_by(U, I) :- User(U), Invoice(I).
datalog_actions: cannot_perform_both(U, I) :- User(U), Invoice(I), recorded_by(U, I), verified_by(U, I).

natural_language_statements: A subject cannot review a project he or she has submitted.
datalog_actions: can_review(S, P) :- Subject(S), Project(P), not has_submitted(S, P).

natural_language_statements: A subject cannot approve projects he or she has reviewed or submitted.
datalog_relationships:
has_reviewed(S, P) :- Subject(S), Project(P).
has_submitted(S, P) :- Subject(S), Project(P).
datalog_actions: can_approve(S, P) :- Subject(S), Project(P), not has_reviewed(S, P), not has_submitted(S, P).

natural_language_statements: Authors of papers cannot be changed.
datalog_actions: can_change_author(A, P, A2) :- Author(A), Paper(P), Author(A2), has_author(P, A), false.

natural_language_statements: The PC chair can assign a paper to a PC member for reviewing, except if he is one of its authors.
datalog_actions: can_assign(C, M, P) :- PC_Chair(C), PC_Member(M), Paper(P), not is_author(M, P).

natural_language_statements: A reviewer of a paper can resign, unless he has already appointed a sub-reviewer for the paper.
datalog_relationships: assigned_to(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P). appointed_subreviewer(R, P, S) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), SubReviewer(S).
datalog_actions: can_resign(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), assigned_to(R, P), not appointed_subreviewer(R, P, _).

natural_language_statements: A sub-reviewer can resign, unless he has already submitted his review.
datalog_actions: can_resign(S) :- SubReviewer(S), not has_submitted(S, R).

natural_language_statements: There do not exist members of Student who can Assign ExternalGrades.
datalog_actions: can_assign(S, EG) :- Student(S), ExternalGrade(EG), false.

natural_language_statements: No combination of roles exists such that a user with those roles can both Receive and Assign the resource ExternalGrades.
datalog_actions: can_receive(U, EG) :- User(U), ExternalGrades(EG), has_role(U, R). can_assign(U, EG) :- User(U), ExternalGrades(EG), has_role(U, R). not (can_receive(U, EG), can_assign(U, EG)).

natural_language_statements: If the subject is a student, then do not permit that subject to assign grades.
datalog_actions: can_assign_grade(S, G) :- Subject(S), Grade(G), not is_student(S).

natural_language_statements: So, for example, the manager should be made aware of repeated attempts by a health care worker to access information beyond their rights.
datalog_actions: alert_manager(M, H, I) :- Manager(M), HealthCareWorker(H), Information(I), attempted_access(H, I), not authorized_access(H, I).

natural_language_statements: The doctor then has temporary access to the resident’s medical records (but not to the private notes of the resident’s usual doctor).
datalog_relationships:
has_medical_record(R, MR) :- Resident(R), MedicalRecord(MR).
has_private_note(R, PN) :- Resident(R), PrivateNote(PN).
usual_doctor(R, D) :- Resident(R), Doctor(D).
datalog_actions:
can_access(D, MR) :- Doctor(D), Resident(R), MedicalRecord(MR), has_medical_record(R, MR).
not can_access(D, PN) :- Doctor(D), Resident(R), PrivateNote(PN), has_private_note(R, PN), usual_doctor(R, D).

natural_language_statements: In an electronic system we can allow residents to hook into the network at any time as long as they can view only their own data and cannot make arbitrary changes.
datalog_actions:
can_view(R, D) :- Resident(R), Data(D), owns(R, D).
can_modify(R, D) :- false.

natural_language_statements: This critical task should not be performed by a single user.
datalog_actions: can_perform(U, T) :- User(U), Task(T), not is_critical(T).

natural_language_statements: However, it should not perform these operations when it is loading medicines to the medicine dispenser.
datalog_actions: can_perform_operations(S, O) :- System(S), Operator(O), not loading_medicines(S, D).

natural_language_statements: An administrator shall not be permitted to read or write to medical elements of a patient record.
datalog_actions: not can_read(A, E) :- Administrator(A), MedicalElement(E), contains(R, E). not can_write(A, E) :- Administrator(A), MedicalElement(E), contains(R, E).

natural_language_statements: There do not exist members of STUDENT who can ASSIGN EXTERNALGRADES.
datalog_actions: can_assign(S, EG) :- Student(S), ExternalGrade(EG), false.

natural_language_statements: There exists no combination of roles such that a user with those roles can both RECEIVE and ASSIGN the resource EXTERNALGRADES.
datalog_actions: can_receive(U, EXTERNALGRADES) :- User(U), Resource(EXTERNALGRADES), has_role(U, R). can_assign(U, EXTERNALGRADES) :- User(U), Resource(EXTERNALGRADES), has_role(U, R). not (can_receive(U, EXTERNALGRADES), can_assign(U, EXTERNALGRADES)) :- User(U), Resource(EXTERNALGRADES).

natural_language_statements: If a subject is not a pc-chair or admin, then he or she may not set the meeting flag.
datalog_actions: can_set_meeting_flag(S, MF) :- Subject(S), MeetingFlag(MF), (is_pc_chair(S); is_admin(S)).

natural_language_statements: If someone is not a pc-chair or admin, then he or she can never see paper-review-rc for which he or she is conflicted.
datalog_relationships:
is_pc_chair(P) :- Person(P).
is_admin(P) :- Person(P).
is_conflicted(P, PR) :- Person(P), PaperReviewRC(PR).
datalog_actions:
can_see(P, PR) :- Person(P), PaperReviewRC(PR), (is_pc_chair(P) ; is_admin(P)), not is_conflicted(P, PR).
can_see(P, PR) :- Person(P), PaperReviewRC(PR), not is_pc_chair(P), not is_admin(P), not is_conflicted(P, PR).

natural_language_statements: Authors may never read scores.
datalog_actions: cannot_read(A, S) :- Author(A), Score(S).

natural_language_statements: Doctors need not sign a confidentiality agreement since they are bound by a code of professional conduct.
datalog_actions: need_not_sign(D, CA) :- Doctor(D), ConfidentialityAgreement(CA), bound_by_code(D).

natural_language_statements: Requests for students to Receive ExternalGrades
datalog_relationships: can_receive_external_grade(S, EG) :- Student(S), ExternalGrade(EG), requested(S, EG).
datalog_actions: receive_external_grade(S, EG) :- Student(S), ExternalGrade(EG), can_receive_external_grade(S, EG).

natural_language_statements: faculty to Assign and View both InternalGrades and ExternalGrades, will succeed.
datalog_actions: can_assign(F, IG) :- Faculty(F), InternalGrade(IG). can_assign(F, EG) :- Faculty(F), ExternalGrade(EG). can_view(F, IG) :- Faculty(F), InternalGrade(IG). can_view(F, EG) :- Faculty(F), ExternalGrade(EG).

natural_language_statements: Only the manager is allowed to add a new resident to the system and
datalog_actions: can_add(M, R) :- Manager(M), Resident(R).

natural_language_statements: Only the manager is allowed to start or update the care plan of a resident.
datalog_actions: can_start_or_update(M, R, CP) :- Manager(M), Resident(R), CarePlan(CP), manages(M, R).

natural_language_statements: Their main form of access is to view the care plan for each resident
datalog_actions: can_view(S, R, CP) :- Staff(S), Resident(R), CarePlan(CP), has_care_plan(R, CP).

natural_language_statements: Their main form of access is to add progress note entries based on their observations.
datalog_actions: can_add(U, PN) :- User(U), ProgressNote(PN), has_observation(U, PN).

natural_language_statements: A visiting doctor has access to all the medical information of residents who are his or her patients
datalog_actions: has_access(D, MI) :- Doctor(D), MedicalInfo(MI), Resident(R), is_patient_of(R, D).

natural_language_statements: A visiting doctor can add entries to patients medical records.
datalog_actions: can_add_entry(D, P, E) :- Doctor(D), Patient(P), MedicalRecordEntry(E), is_visiting_doctor(D, P).

natural_language_statements: Managers can read and set ordinary employees’ bonuses.
datalog_actions: can_read(M, E, B) :- Manager(M), Employee(E), Bonus(B), manages(M, E). can_set(M, E, B) :- Manager(M), Employee(E), Bonus(B), manages(M, E).

natural_language_statements: but not those of other managers or the director can read and set ordinary employees’ bonuses
datalog_relationships: is_manager_of(M, E) :- Manager(M), Employee(E). is_director_of(D, E) :- Director(D), Employee(E).
datalog_actions: can_read_and_set_bonus(M, E, B) :- Manager(M), Employee(E), Bonus(B), is_manager_of(M, E), not is_director_of(D, E), not (Manager(OtherM), OtherM != M, is_manager_of(OtherM, E)).

natural_language_statements: Every subject in the hierarchy can submit a project.
datalog_actions: can_submit(S, P) :- Subject(S), Project(P), in_hierarchy(S).

natural_language_statements: except the business office manager can submit a project
datalog_actions:
can_submit(BOM, P) :- BusinessOfficeManager(BOM), Project(P).
can_submit(U, P) :- OtherUser(U), Project(P), not is_business_office_manager(U).

natural_language_statements: Every professor can review a project.
datalog_actions: can_review(P, PR) :- Professor(P), Project(PR).

natural_language_statements: except assistant professors, can review a project
datalog_actions: can_review(P, PR) :- Professor(P), Project(PR), not is_assistant_professor(P).

natural_language_statements: All PC members know who are the reviewers for this paper.
datalog_actions: knows_reviewer(M, P, R) :- PC_Member(M), Paper(P), Reviewer(R), assigned_reviewer(P, R).

natural_language_statements: author(s) of a paper can not know who are the reviewers for this paper
datalog_relationships: authored_by(P, A) :- Paper(P), Author(A). assigned_reviewer(P, R) :- Paper(P), Reviewer(R).
datalog_actions: cannot_know(A, R, P) :- Author(A), Reviewer(R), Paper(P), authored_by(P, A), assigned_reviewer(P, R).

natural_language_statements: TA can view and assign InternalGrades
datalog_relationships: can_view(T, G) :- TA(T), InternalGrade(G). can_assign(T, G) :- TA(T), InternalGrade(G).
datalog_actions: view_action(T, G) :- can_view(T, G). assign_action(T, G) :- can_assign(T, G).

natural_language_statements: TA can not view and assign  ExternalGrades (since faculty must take final responsibility for all external grades), combined with Pol3.
datalog_actions: can_view(T, EG) :- TA(T), ExternalGrade(EG), false. can_assign(T, EG) :- TA(T), ExternalGrade(EG), false.

natural_language_statements: Although she can enter the past medical records when a resident is admitted,
datalog_actions: can_enter(N, MR) :- Nurse(N), MedicalRecord(MR), Resident(R), is_admitted(R).

natural_language_statements: she cannot subsequently add medical entries to the system.
datalog_actions: can_add(U, ME) :- User(U), MedicalEntry(ME), not has_restriction(U).

natural_language_statements: Also, she cannot view the private notes of doctors
datalog_actions: can_view(U, N) :- User(U), PrivateNote(N), not (Doctor(D), has_note(D, N)).

natural_language_statements: clearly she cannot sign the legal agreement on behalf of a resident.
datalog_actions: can_sign(S, A, R) :- Person(S), LegalAgreement(A), Resident(R), not is_resident(R).

natural_language_statements: Health care workers can view recent medical records of residents (up to one year old)
datalog_actions: can_view(H, R, M) :- HealthCareWorker(H), Resident(R), MedicalRecord(M), has_record(R, M), recent(M).

natural_language_statements: Health care workers cannot normally view older medical information.
datalog_actions: cannot_view(H, M) :- HealthCareWorker(H), MedicalInfo(M), is_older(M).

natural_language_statements: Doctors also can add private notes about a resident, which, on the basis of doctor-patient confidentiality.
datalog_actions: can_add_private_note(D, R, N) :- Doctor(D), Resident(R), PrivateNote(N), has_confidentiality(D, R).

natural_language_statements: Private notes about a resident, which, on the basis of doctor-patient confidentiality, are not visible to health care staff or the manager.
datalog_actions:
can_view(D, N) :- Doctor(D), PrivateNote(N), has_note(R, N).
not can_view(H, N) :- HealthCareStaff(H), PrivateNote(N), has_note(R, N).
not can_view(M, N) :- Manager(M), PrivateNote(N), has_note(R, N).

natural_language_statements: Pharmacy System should not read patient records
datalog_actions: cannot_read(PS, PR) :- PharmacySystem(PS), PatientRecord(PR).

natural_language_statements: Pharmacy System can read patient medicine orders.
datalog_actions: can_read(PS, MO) :- PharmacySystem(PS), MedicineOrder(MO), Patient(P), has_order(P, MO).

natural_language_statements: Users can view an Owner's account,
datalog_actions: can_view(U, A) :- User(U), Account(A), Owner(O), owns(O, A).

natural_language_statements: Users can not make changes to Owner's account
datalog_actions: cannot_change(U, A) :- User(U), Account(A), Owner(O), owns(O, A).

natural_language_statements: Only administrators make changes to a resource's security label.
datalog_actions: can_change_security_label(U, R) :- User(U), Resource(R), is_admin(U).

natural_language_statements: not data owners make changes to a resource's security label.
datalog_actions: can_change_security_label(U, R, SL) :- User(U), Resource(R), SecurityLabel(SL), not owner_of(U, R).

natural_language_statements: Owners cannot change any data
datalog_actions: cannot_change(O, D) :- Owner(O), Data(D).

natural_language_statements: Owners can read data all.
datalog_actions: can_read(O, D) :- Owner(O), Data(D).
